column4: so, i'm trying to build my own package for sun-j2sdk1.5, as instructed by http://www.ubuntulinux.org/wiki/Java ....but I can't get the 'dpkg -i' and 'apt-get install' steps to complete. Both steps error out saying "file not found" basically. The wiki says the first step will error, but that the second one will work properly...
are you pointing to the actual file?
well, i would if I knew what it was. The steps are just listed complete, so i'm doing it verbatim
part of the process is creating a file
no kidding...
that's the file you want to install
how do i know what file it created?
that's the file you're trying to install
so, how am i supposed to know what file got created? none of the commands the wiki says to run specify the output file.
surely the dpkg -i <package> line specifies the name?

well, it specifies what I took to be the input file....but that's the command that's saying file not found. and i'm using the exact same filename after -i that it shows in the wiki, and then in the next step i'm using the same thing also.
if you've followed the process, you'll have a .deb file there
that's what you're meant to be installing
i *did* follow the process, and i don't have a .deb file anywhere i can detect.
so something went wrong :)
is it supposed to be in the directory i was in when i did all that stuff?
no kidding?
well, if you don't have a .deb file, i can only assume something went wrong
i sort of started with that knowledge. i came in here hoping to find out WHAT went wrong
go through the steps again, watch the output
check what files exist at each point, etc.
so, is it the fakeroot step that's supposed to create the .deb file?
sure
strongly recommend using fakeroot instead.
